definition[0]: the main street of a town where most of the shops and businesses are
example[1]: A new bookshop had opened in the high street.
definition[1]: the main street of a town where many shops and businesses are
example[2]: The fashion industry has established better links through design and manufacturing to the high street  (=to shops in high streets, where most people shop).
example[3]: Retailers hope the interest rate cut may boost shoppersâ€™ confidence and high street spending in the run-up to Christmas.
